Ruach一词为希伯来文罗马字，原意是‘风’，引申为‘灵’，属意最干净、纯洁的物，为一至上精神。惟其公司使用Ruach作为自己的品牌，倡导‘以勇敢的心，纯洁的灵，活出干净的人生。’，做品牌如做人，数十年如一日，Ruach已经成为台湾最有价值的品牌之一。希伯来文罗马字 RuachRuach在希伯来文里本来指的是风（wind），引申为灵（spirit）。这个词有许多意义(wind, breath, life, anger.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)begin to suspect that (something) is happening; hear a rumour of
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)开始觉察；听到…的风声，获悉…的消息

lj.lj_ly: Mortimer got wind of a plot being hatched.
lj.lj_ls: 莫蒂默听风声说有人正在策划阴谋。

phrase.cizu_name: it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)few things are so bad that no one profits from them
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)使人人遭殃的风才是恶风；世上鲜有绝对的坏事；害于此者利于彼

lj.lj_ly: she ran like the wind back to the house.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)alarm or frighten (or be alarmed or frightened)

lj.lj_ly: he was trying to put the wind up him with stories of how hard teaching was.
lj.lj_ls: 他正极力用教学如何如何困难的说法来吓唬他。

phrase.cizu_name: sail close to (或 near) the wind

jx.jx_en_mean: (Sailing)sail as nearly against the wind as is consistent with using its force

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)行为几失检点；近乎不老实；濒临险境

phrase.cizu_name: take the wind out of someone's sails

jx.jx_en_mean: frustrate someone by unexpectedly anticipating an action or remark
jx.jx_cn_mean: 先发制人；冷不防挫败某人

phrase.cizu_name: to the wind(s) (或 the four winds)

lj.lj_ly: my little flock scatters to the four winds.
lj.lj_ls: 我的一小群羊分散四方。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a mechanism, especially one operated by clockwork) gradually lose power
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指用发条驱动的机械装置）渐渐停下

jx.jx_en_mean: arrive or end up in a specified state, situation, or place
jx.jx_cn_mean: 抵达；（以某状态，情况或在某地）结束

lj.lj_ly: Kevin winds up in New York .

jx.jx_en_mean: another way of saying wind something up (in sense 2)

lj.lj_ly: he wound up by attacking Nonconformists.
lj.lj_ls: 最终他选择攻击那些不信奉国教者。

jx.jx_en_mean: (一般作 be wound up)make tense or angry

lj.lj_ly: he was clearly wound up and frantic about his daughter.
lj.lj_ls: 很明显，他被女儿气得发疯。

jx.jx_en_mean: arrange the affairs of and dissolve a company

lj.lj_ly: the company has since been wound up.

jx.jx_en_mean: gradually or finally bring an activity to a conclusion

lj.lj_ly: the experiments had to be wound up because the funding stopped.
lj.lj_ls: 因为资金资助已停止，这些实验不得不被终止。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)increase the tension, intensity, or power of something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)增加某物的紧张度（或强度、力量）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wind and German Wind, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin ventus
Old English windan 'go rapidly', 'twine', of Germanic origin; related to wander and wend

encyclopedia.content: 动画歌曲简介 《火影忍者-ナルト-》ED1名称 Wind 译名：风 词/曲/歌 Akeboshi PS：被很多网友誉为动漫十大伤感歌曲之一。 人群背后总是有一个小男孩默默地伫立着，他因为身上被封印着怪物而被人们躲避、唾骂、蔑视。孤独的他拼命地向前奔跑、奔跑…… 一幅幅昏黄映画式的画面述说着主角鸣人凄凉无助的童年，歌手沙哑的声音拌着悲凉的曲风展示着歌曲的魅丽。 整首歌就像是在叙说着一个故事，娓娓道来，伴着音乐的变化起起落落。但

entry.def: A wind is a current of air that is moving across the earth's surface.

example.ex: There was a strong wind blowing...
Then the wind dropped and the surface of the sea was still...
example.tran: 后来风势渐弱，海面重归平静。

entry.tran: (影响事件的)趋势（或因素）（常作新闻用语）
entry.def: Journalists often refer to a trend or factor that influences events as a wind of a particular kind.

example.ex: The winds of change are blowing across the country...
The world's entire aerospace industry is feeling the chill winds of recession.
example.tran: 全世界的航空航天工业都感受到了经济衰退的寒意。

entry.def: If you are winded by something such as a blow, the air is suddenly knocked out of your lungs so that you have difficulty breathing for a short time.

example.ex: The cow stamped on his side, winding him.
example.tran: 牛重重地踩在他的肋部，使他喘不上气来。

entry.def: Wind is the air that you sometimes swallow with food or drink, or gas that is produced in your intestines, which causes an uncomfortable feeling.
If you wind a baby, you hit its back gently in order to help it to release air from its stomach.

example.ex: If he cries when you put him down after a feed, try winding him.
example.tran: 如果你喂完后把他放下时他哭，给他拍拍嗝儿。

entry.def: The wind section of an orchestra or band is the group of people who produce musical sounds by blowing into their instruments.
If someone breaks wind, they release gas from their intestines through their anus.
If you get wind of something, you hear about it, especially when someone else did not want you to know about it.

example.ex: I don't want the public, and especially not the press, to get wind of it at this stage.
example.tran: 我不想让公众，尤其是新闻界，在这个阶段听到什么风声。

entry.def: If something is in the wind, it is likely to happen.

example.ex: By the mid-1980s, change was in the wind again.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代中期，变革又呈山雨欲来之势。

entry.def: If something or someone puts the wind up you, they frighten or worry you.

example.ex: 'I heard you had some funny phone calls.' — 'Yeah, that's why yours rather put the wind up me.'
example.tran: “我听说你接到了一些骚扰电话。”——“没错儿，所以你的电话把我吓坏了。”

entry.def: If you sail close to the wind, you take a risk by doing or saying something that may get you into trouble.

example.ex: Max warned her she was sailing dangerously close to the wind and risked prosecution.
example.tran: 马克斯警告她说她这是在玩火，有被起诉的危险。

entry.def: If something takes the wind out of your sails, it suddenly makes you much less confident in what you are doing or saying.

entry.tran: 可能发生何事;事态的发展
entry.def: If you realize or find out which way the wind is blowing or how the wind is blowing, you realize or find out what is likely to happen, for example whether something is likely to succeed.

example.ex: He didn't like to make pronouncements before he was sure which way the wind was blowing.
example.tran: 在没有弄清事态的走向前，他不想发表声明。

entry.tran: (道路、河流或一队人)蜿蜒向前，曲折而行，迂回
entry.def: If a road, river, or line of people winds in a particular direction, it goes in that direction with a lot of bends or twists in it.

example.ex: The Moselle winds through some 160 miles of tranquil countryside...
example.tran: 摩泽尔河在宁静的乡间蜿蜒穿行约160英里。

entry.def: When you wind something flexible around something else, you wrap it around it several times.

example.ex: The horse jumped forwards and round her, winding the rope round her waist.
example.tran: 那匹马围着她向前跳，把绳子绕在了她腰上。

entry.tran: 给(钟表等)上发条;给…上弦
entry.def: When you wind a mechanical device, for example a watch or a clock, you turn a knob, key, or handle on it several times in order to make it operate.

example.ex: I still hadn't wound my watch so I didn't know the time.
example.tran: 我还没有给表上发条，所以不知道时间。

entry.def: To wind a tape or film back or forward means to make it move towards its starting or ending position.

example.ex: The camcorder winds the tape back or forward at high speed.
example.tran: 这款便携式摄像机可以使录像带快速倒回或前进。

means.word_mean: 1. air moving (sometimes with considerable force) from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure;

sentences.sentence: "the radioactivity was being swept upwards by the air current and out into the atmosphere"

means.word_mean: 2. a tendency or force that influences events;
3. breath;

sentences.sentence: "the collision knocked the wind out of him"

means.word_mean: 4. empty rhetoric or insincere or exaggerated talk;

sentences.sentence: "don't give me any of that jazz"

means.word_mean: 5. an indication of potential opportunity;

sentences.sentence: "he got a tip on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 6. a musical instrument in which the sound is produced by an enclosed column of air that is moved by the breath
7. a reflex that expels intestinal gas through the anus
8. the act of winding or twisting;

sentences.sentence: "he put the key in the old clock and gave it a good wind"

means.word_mean: 1. to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course;

sentences.sentence: "sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body"

means.word_mean: 2. extend in curves and turns;
3. wrap or coil around;
4. catch the scent of; get wind of;
5. coil the spring of (some mechanical device) by turning a stem;
6. form into a wreath
7. raise or haul up with or as if with mechanical help;

sentences.sentence: "hoist the bicycle onto the roof of the car"

example.en: I recall a small vogue for the Blues on the old wind-box.
example.zh: 我同想起一支用老式风琴演奏的流行小曲《勃鲁斯乐曲》。

example.en: Do you want to go by wind-wagon or train?
example.zh: 你想乘飞机去还是乘火车去？

Sentence.sentence: Alternative forms of energy- bio-fuels, wind and solar, to name a few are certainly being funded and developed, and will play a growingrolein the world's energy supply.

For example, even with significantinvestments, such as the $93 million for wind energy development included in the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, important alternative energy sources such as wind and bio-fuels comprise only about 1% of the market today

For example, even with significantinvestments, such as the $93 million for wind energy development included in the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, important alternative energy sources such as wind and bio-fuels comprise only about 1% of the market today

More than paradise lost, a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin.
The changed patterns of winds and rains in the Amazon area
We can tear apart the great grass cover of the western plains and pour toxic chemicals into the soil until the soil is dead and blows away in the wind.

means.word_mean: 风, 气流

sentences.en: A gentle wind disturbed the surface of the water.
These young men are advancing against the winds and waves.
sentences.cn: 这些年轻人迎着风浪前进。

sentences.en: The rocks were shaped by sun, wind and rain.
sentences.cn: 太阳, 风和雨使岩石变形了。

sentences.en: The wind blew out the candle.
There is not much wind today.
The wind of war had swept his home away.

means.word_mean: 呼吸, （运动或吹奏乐器时的）呼吸

sentences.en: Climbing these stairs takes all the wind out of him.

means.word_mean: 缠绕, 卷绕, 卷缠, 绕成团

sentences.en: The man's arm was wound with bandages.
sentences.cn: 那人的胳膊上裹着绷带。

means.word_mean: 给…上发条, 能（通过转动把手等）操作

sentences.en: It's time to wind your watch.

means.word_mean: 迂回, 蜿蜒

jushi.english: If the deer catches wind of us, he'll ran into the woods.
jushi.chinese: 鹿一闻到我们的气味就会跑进森林。

jushi.english: The blow knocked the wind out of him.
The deer got wind of the hunter and ran off.
jushi.chinese: 鹿觉察到猎人的气味,便逃跑了。
